alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 18 at 4:22AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST/NOON MDT/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Cataract Creek and Havasu Creek from Redlands Crossing to the Colorado River. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM MST Saturday /noon MDT Saturday/. * IMPACTS...Flooding of Cataract Creek and Havasu Creek imminent or occurring with further rises in the water levels expected this morning and early afternoon. Deadly flooding over low-water crossings and minor flooding in the Supai campground is expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 410 AM MST /510 AM MDT/, stream gauge reports along Cataract Creek upstream from Supai show a peak flow occurred and is beginning to fall. Elevated water levels will continue through Supai throughout the morning and early afternoon. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Havasu Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Havasupai Reservation and Supai. - This includes the following swimming holes... All swimming holes on Havasu Creek near Supai. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
